scenarios.label: Baseline / Recommended
scenarios.description: Production BI platform using Microsoft Fabric F64 capacity with ~50 TB OneLake storage and daily refresh workloads.

resources.notes: Dedicated Microsoft Fabric F64 capacity for BI, data engineering, and Power BI workloads. Assumes 24x7 production usage. Egress and operations are rough estimates for report consumption and data refresh. vcores approximated from F64 naming.

sku_candidates.meter_name: Cosmos DB Backup Storage Data Stored

resources.notes: Represents OneLake underlying storage as Azure Storage (for cost modeling). 50 TB total, assumed all Hot tier, GRS for production durability. Operations and egress sized for daily refresh of multiple datasets and analytical workloads.
resources.meter_name: Hot Data Returned for Query Acceleration
resources.product_name: Azure Data Lake Storage Gen2 Hierarchical Namespace

sku_candidates.meter_name: Hot Data Returned for Query Acceleration
sku_candidates.product_name: Azure Data Lake Storage Gen2 Hierarchical Namespace

resources.notes: Azure Data Factory (or Fabric Data Pipelines equivalent) for orchestrating daily refresh and ingestion from external systems. Metrics approximate pipeline runs and data movement; ADF is mainly activity-based billing.
Representative Azure SQL Database as a structured data source for the BI platform. GP_Gen5_8 for moderate OLTP and nightly/daily extraction. Storage sized at 512 GB as a working assumption.
resources.product_name: SQL Database Single/Elastic Pool General Purpose - Compute Gen5

sku_candidates.product_name: SQL Database Single/Elastic Pool General Purpose - Compute Gen5
SQL Database Single/Elastic Pool General Purpose - Compute Gen5
SQL Database Single/Elastic Pool General Purpose - Compute Gen5
SQL Database Single/Elastic Pool General Purpose - Compute Gen5
SQL Database Single/Elastic Pool General Purpose - Compute Gen5

resources.notes: Virtual network for securing data sources, gateways, and any self-hosted integration runtimes. No direct cost but required for network topology.
NAT Gateway for outbound internet access from private resources (e.g., self-hosted IR, gateways). Egress_gb approximates combined outbound traffic for data ingestion and refresh.
resources.meter_name: Standard Inter-Availability Zone Data Transfer Out

sku_candidates.meter_name: Standard Inter-Availability Zone Data Transfer Out

resources.notes: Standard public IP associated with NAT Gateway for outbound connectivity.
Azure Key Vault for connection strings, secrets, and keys used by data pipelines and integration runtimes. Standard tier assumed.
Central Log Analytics workspace for monitoring Fabric, data pipelines, gateways, and related Azure resources. 200 GB/month ingestion with archive after retention period is a working assumption.
Recovery Services vault for backups of supporting components (e.g., self-hosted IR VMs, config backups). 250 GB backup storage assumed in cool-like tier.
resources.meter_name: ADLS Gen2 Vaulted LRS Write Operations

sku_candidates.meter_name: ADLS Gen2 Vaulted LRS Write Operations
ADLS Gen2 Vaulted ZRS Write Operations
ADLS Gen2 Vaulted RA-GRS Write Operations
ADLS Gen2 Vaulted GRS Write Operations

resources.notes: Azure Site Recovery for 2 protected instances (e.g., self-hosted integration runtime or gateway VMs) to a paired region. Storage_gb for replicated data is approximate.

scenarios.label: Cost Optimized
scenarios.description: Lower-cost BI platform variant using Microsoft Fabric F64 with reduced redundancy and lower surrounding resource sizes, suitable for non-critical or pilot workloads.

resources.notes: Same F64 capacity but assumed not running 24x7 (e.g., business hours or partial month) to reduce cost. Suitable for non-prod or pilot environments.

sku_candidates.meter_name: Cosmos DB Backup Storage Data Stored

resources.notes: 50 TB OneLake modeled as LRS storage with tiering: 30 TB Hot for active data, 21.2 TB Cool for historical data to reduce cost. No GRS.
resources.meter_name: Hot Data Returned for Query Acceleration, Cool Data Scanned for Query Acceleration
resources.product_name: Azure Data Lake Storage Gen2 Hierarchical Namespace, Azure Data Lake Storage Gen2 Hierarchical Namespace

sku_candidates.product_name: Azure Data Lake Storage Gen2 Hierarchical Namespace

resources.notes: Reduced orchestration usage for dev/test with fewer pipeline runs and lower data movement.
Smaller Azure SQL Database for non-prod workloads with reduced storage and compute.

resources.notes: Virtual network for dev/test connectivity. No direct cost.
NAT Gateway with reduced active hours and egress for non-prod workloads.

resources.notes: Public IP for NAT Gateway with reduced hours.
Key Vault for dev/test secrets with lower operation volume.
Lower ingestion volume and shorter retention for dev/test monitoring.
Reduced backup footprint for non-critical workloads. ASR intentionally omitted to save cost.

scenarios.label: High Performance / Enterprise
scenarios.description: Enterprise-grade BI platform using Microsoft Fabric F64 with 24x7 usage, higher network and storage throughput, and stronger HA/DR assumptions.

resources.notes: F64 capacity with 1-year or 3-year reserved commitment for cost efficiency at high utilization. Higher egress and operations to reflect heavy report usage and frequent refreshes.
resources.error: Reservation unit of measure looks hourly/monthly; treated as ambiguous

resources.notes: OneLake modeled as Premium ZRS storage for higher throughput and zone redundancy. All 50 TB kept Hot for maximum performance.
resources.meter_name: Hot Data Returned for Query Acceleration
resources.product_name: Azure Data Lake Storage Gen2 Flat Namespace

sku_candidates.meter_name: Hot Data Returned for Query Acceleration
sku_candidates.product_name: Azure Data Lake Storage Gen2 Flat Namespace

resources.notes: Heavier orchestration with more frequent incremental loads and complex pipelines. Metrics reflect higher activity counts and data movement.
Larger Azure SQL Database with reserved capacity for high-volume transactional sources and frequent extracts.
resources.product_name: SQL Database Single/Elastic Pool General Purpose - Compute Gen5

sku_candidates.product_name: SQL Database Single/Elastic Pool General Purpose - Compute Gen5
SQL Database Single/Elastic Pool General Purpose - Compute Gen5
SQL Database SingleDB/Elastic Pool Hyperscale - Compute Gen5
SQL Database Single/Elastic Pool Business Critical - Compute Gen5

resources.error: Reservation unit of measure looks hourly/monthly; treated as ambiguous

resources.notes: Enterprise VNet for secure connectivity, potentially with multiple subnets and peering to hub VNets.
Two NAT Gateways for high-throughput outbound traffic and zonal resilience. Egress sized for heavy data movement to/from external systems.
resources.meter_name: Standard Inter-Availability Zone Data Transfer Out

sku_candidates.meter_name: Standard Inter-Availability Zone Data Transfer Out

resources.notes: Standard public IPs for each NAT Gateway.
Premium Key Vault for HSM-backed keys and higher security requirements.
Higher ingestion and longer retention for detailed observability and auditing. Split between standard and archive retention.
Larger backup footprint for supporting components with longer retention.

resources.notes: ASR for 4 protected instances (e.g., multiple self-hosted IR/gateway nodes) to a paired region, providing stronger DR posture.
